Sentence.sentence: They are more likely to be at risk of dying.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The birds can easily eat pieces of plastic or rubber hands and they can die, said Flack.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Andrea Flack of the Max Planck Institute found that birds following traditional migration routes were more likely to die than German storks that flew only as far as northern Morocco, and spent the winter there on rubbish dumps.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Why should you consider taking a course in demography in college? You’ll be growing up in a generation where the baby boomers are going into retirement and dying.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Nearly 2.2 million people die a year because of diarrhea-related ( ' ,  与腹泻相关 的) diseases, according to WHO statistics.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Mothers have been warned for years that sleeping with their newborn infant is a bad idea, because it increases the risk that the baby might die unexpectedly during the night.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: One reason for the rise in deaths from Alzheimer’s disease in this group may be that developing this condition remains possible even after people beat the odds of dying from other diseases such as cancer.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: 18,434 centenarias died in 2000, whereas 25,914 died in 2014.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Why does love die?Changing technology and markets have stimulated the team approach tomanagement.

Sentence.sentence: In Pakistan, 1,000women die in honor killings every year.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That's the sound of a dying forest.

Sentence.sentence: trees that are dying usually give out a soft moan
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: So when fly the north, they might lay eggs in Louisiana and die.

Sentence.sentence: However, soon after these fierce outbreaks, the virus died out, at least temporarily.

Sentence.sentence: Just one more, then he died in that car crash in California in 1955.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: But once these plants use up their stored reserve or tap out the underground supply, they cease growing and start to die.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词或短语动词均有"死，死亡"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: die, decease, expire, perish, pass away
means: die ： 最普通用词，指某人或某物失去生命而永远不存在。
decease ： 正式用词，多指法律上的用语。
expire ： 委婉用词。从本义"从肺部吐出气来"引申为吐出最后一口气，断气而死。
perish ： 书面用词，多指夭折或不幸暴亡。

list.explanation: 尽心竭力的(地)，顽强的(地)，不达目的决不罢休的(地)

example.en: He has the obsessive do or die attitude.
example.zh: 他具有极其顽强的态度。

example.en: I was determined to get there—do or die.
example.zh: 我已下定决心要去那儿——不到那儿誓不罢休。

example.en: We had a beautiful room at the hotel and the service was to die for.
example.zh: 我们住在那家旅馆里，不仅房间很漂亮，而且服务很周到。

entry.def: When people, animals, and plants die, they stop living.

example.ex: A year later my dog died...
Sadly, both he and my mother died of cancer...
example.tran: 非常不幸的是，他和我母亲都死于癌症。

entry.def: If a person, animal, or plant is dying, they are so ill or so badly injured that they will not live very much longer.

example.ex: The elm trees are all dying...
example.tran: 那些榆树全都奄奄一息了。

example.ex: Every working day I treat people who are dying from lung diseases caused by smoking.
example.tran: 每天上班我都要医治那些因吸烟患上肺病的垂危患者。

entry.def: If someone dies a violent, unnatural, or painful death, they die in a violent, unnatural, or painful way.

example.ex: He watched helplessly as his mother died an agonizing death...
example.tran: 他无助地看着母亲痛苦地死去。

example.ex: I'm no expert, but I don't think Tracy died a natural death.
example.tran: 我不是什么专家，但我不认为特蕾西是自然死亡。

entry.def: If a machine or device dies, it stops completely, especially after a period of working more and more slowly or inefficiently.

example.ex: Then suddenly, the engine coughed, spluttered and died.
example.tran: 然后，发动机突然咔咔地响着，发出一阵噼啪声，接着就彻底熄火了。

entry.def: If a fire or light dies, it stops burning or shining.

example.ex: Her cigarette glowed brightly, then died.
example.tran: 她的香烟燃起一阵亮光，然后就熄灭了。

entry.def: If an emotion or facial expression dies, it disappears completely, usually after a period of gradually becoming weaker and less noticeable.

example.ex: My love for you will never die...
Kathryn looked down at the floor and the smile died on her lips.
example.tran: 凯瑟琳低头看向地板，笑容从她的嘴角消失了。

entry.def: You can say that you are dying of thirst, hunger, boredom, or curiosity to emphasize that you are very thirsty, hungry, bored, or curious.
entry.tran: (渴、饿、闷或好奇)得要命;…得要死

example.ex: Order me a pot of tea, I'm dying of thirst.
example.tran: 给我来一壶茶，我快要渴死了。

entry.def: You can say that you are dying for something or are dying to do something to emphasize that you very much want to have it or do it.

example.ex: I'm dying for a breath of fresh air...
example.tran: 我非常渴望能呼吸到新鲜空气。

example.ex: She was dying to talk to Frank.

entry.def: You can use die in expressions such as 'I almost died' or 'I'd die if anything happened' where you are emphasizing your feelings about a situation, for example to say that it is very shocking, upsetting, embarrassing, or amusing.
entry.tran: (用于强调震惊、不安、窘迫或好笑等)我差点要死/（如果发生某事）我会死的

example.ex: I nearly died when I learned where I was ending up...
example.tran: 得知自己到了哪里时，我简直要晕过去了。

entry.def: A die is a specially shaped or patterned block of metal which is used to press or cut other metal into a particular shape.
You can say that the die is cast to draw attention to the importance of an event or decision which is going to affect your future and which cannot be changed or avoided.

example.ex: It was too late and too urgent to turn back. The die was cast.
example.tran: 现在为时已晚，来不及回头。事情已成定局了。

entry.def: If you say that habits or attitudes die hard, you mean that they take a very long time to disappear or change, so that it may not be possible to get rid of them completely.
entry.tran: (习惯或观念)难以改掉，很难摆脱

means.word_mean: 1. small cubes with 1 to 6 spots on the faces; used to generate random numbers
2. a device used for shaping metal
3. a cutting tool that is fitted into a diestock and used for cutting male (external) screw threads on screws or bolts or pipes or rods
1. pass from physical life and lose all all bodily attributes and functions necessary to sustain life;
2. suffer or face the pain of death;

sentences.sentence: "Martyrs may die every day for their faith"

means.word_mean: 3. be brought to or as if to the point of death by an intense emotion such as embarrassment, amusement, or shame;

sentences.sentence: "I was dying with embarrassment when my little lie was discovered"
"We almost died laughing during the show"
"The bus we travelled in broke down on the way to town"
"The engine failed on the way to town"
"She died to worldly things and eventually entered a monastery"

means.word_mean: 6. languish as with love or desire;
7. cut or shape with a die;
8. to be on base at the end of an inning, of a player
10. disappear or come to an end;
11. suffer spiritual death; be damned (in the religious sense);

means: Danish Institute for the International Exchange of Scientific and Literary Publications 丹麦国际科学及文学出版物交流学会

sentences.en: The only reason we die, is because we accept death as an inevitability.

sentences.en: It is said that: All leafs will die away, the fall will never stay for anybody.

sentences.en: When the first frost came, most flowers died down.

sentences.en: They often take a long time to die back after flowering.

sentences.cn: 我非常渴望能呼吸到新鲜空气。
sentences.en: I'm dying for a breath of fresh air...

sentences.cn: 不管你住在哪里, 都会有很多当地的乐队渴望有观众.
sentences.en: Wherever you live, are there are a ton of local bands dying for an audience.

sentences.en: Finding reasons to believe her cause you'd die a little if she lied.

sentences.cn: 我渴望有一台电脑.
sentences.en: I'm dying to have a computer.

sentences.cn: 而你遇到的每个男人都渴望爱你爱到死.
sentences.en: And there are every man you meet is dying of love for you.

sentences.cn: 让神成为你的唯一渴望, 因为只有祂才能永生不死.
sentences.en: Make God your only desire, for only he shall live eternally and never die.

sentences.cn: 我渴望听到你的消息.
sentences.en: I am dying to hear your news.

sentences.cn: 我渴望与我男友见面.
sentences.en: I am dying to see my boyfriend.

sentences.cn: 我渴望能说一口流利的英文,并走遍世界每一个角落.
sentences.en: I'm dying to speak perfect English and see every corner of the World.

sentences.cn: 他渴望买一辆新车.
sentences.en: He is dying for buying a new car.

sentences.cn: 我渴望离开这里.
sentences.en: We're dying to get out of here.

sentences.cn: 但是,科学家们仍渴望看到真正的猛犸.

sentences.cn: 我渴望能听到有关你旅行的事.

sentences.cn: 我渴望成为一句老师.

sentences.cn: 她渴望知道你到哪里去了.
sentences.en: She is dying to know where you have been.

sentences.cn: 我渴望着你的爱.
sentences.en: I'm dying for your love.

sentences.cn: 汤姆渴望花一个假期和父母亲在中国旅游.
sentences.en: Tom is dying to spend a vacation travelling with his parents in China.

sentences.cn: 我们渴望学习,我们渴望成长.
sentences.en: We are dying for knowledge and growing up.

sentences.cn: 我知道你非常渴望了解我在这里的生活.
sentences.en: I know you're dying to hear all about my life here.

sentences.cn: 我多年来一直渴望着一个假期.
sentences.en: I've been dying for a vacation for years.

sentences.cn: 我渴望放松一下.
sentences.en: I am dying to relax myself.

sentences.cn: 她渴望一支香烟; 我渴望离开.
sentences.en: She dying for a cigarette; I was dying to leave.

sentences.cn: 现在我渴望死于不死之中.
sentences.en: And now I am eager to die into the deathless.

sentences.cn: 我渴望见到我的偶像.
sentences.en: I'm dying to meet my idol.

sentences.cn: 因希望而活的人,却因渴望而死.
sentences.en: Who live by hope will die by hunger.

sentences.cn: 关于一个你深刻地爱着, 并且渴望和他一起到死的人.
sentences.en: About dying for the one you love, going to the end together.

sentences.cn: 我渴望再见到他.
sentences.en: I am dying to see him again.

sentences.cn: 我渴望获得一笔奖学金.
sentences.en: I'm dying to get a scholarship.

sentences.cn: 恶人一死, 他的指望必灭绝.罪人的盼望,也必灭没.
sentences.en: When a wicked man dies, his hope all he expected from his power comes to nothing.

sentences.cn: 我盼望着再次回到你们身边.
sentences.en: I'm dying to be with you again.

sentences.cn: 从掷一骰子的结果中可以推得出什么结论 呢 ?
sentences.en: What inferences have we been able to draw from one roll of the die?

sentences.en: One die is drawn, rolled once, and comes up ace.

sentences.en: The experiment is rolling a die and flipping a coin.

sentences.en: The first player rolls the die.

sentences.cn: 骰子从桌上滚到了地下.

Sentence.sentence: Hackman ( ' , who died in 2013) noted that teams are hindered by problems of co-ordination and motivation that chip away at the benefits of collaboration.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: People with unhealthy eating habits are likely to die sooner.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Patterns of childhood eating can be hard to break when we're adults, which may mean that kids of depressed moms end up dying younger.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As a day-to-day essential, it will die off with the generation who read print newspapers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: But while printing quickly caused the hand written book to die out, handwriting lingered on (继续存在) well into the 16th century.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Mr Jobs, who died recently aged 56, spent his life packaging that magic into elegantly designed, easy-to-use products.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: There's a flip side, however, as partners are more likely to become ill or die in the couple of years following their spouse's death, and caring for a spouse with mental disorder can leave you with some of the same severe problems.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The effect was first noted in 1858 by William Farr, who wrote that widows and widowers (鳏夫) were at a much higher risk of dying than their married peers.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Her father died when she was 21 and she inherited 7.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: When she died in 1916 she left her children 100 million dollars
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Herpin died at the age of 94, never, it seems, having slept at all.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Benjamin Franklin, a famous American diplomat, writer and scientist, died in 1790, but his proverb "Time is money" is taken more seriously by Americans of today than ever before.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: millions die early from air pollution each year.

Sentence.sentence: While 53% believe men will continue to hold more top executive positions in business in die future, 44% say it's only a matter of time before as many women are in top executive positions as men.
